speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: ACT III

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: SCENE I. OLIVIA's garden.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Enter VIOLA, and Clown with a tabour

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Save thee, friend, and thy music: dost thou live by

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: thy tabour?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: No, sir, I live by the church.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Art thou a churchman?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: No such matter, sir: I do live by the church; for

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I do live at my house, and my house doth stand by

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the church.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: So thou mayst say, the king lies by a beggar, if a

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: beggar dwell near him; or, the church stands by thy

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: tabour, if thy tabour stand by the church.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: You have said, sir. To see this age! A sentence is

speaker: Clown
text_entry: but a cheveril glove to a good wit: how quickly the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: wrong side may be turned outward!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Nay, that's certain; they that dally nicely with

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: words may quickly make them wanton.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I would, therefore, my sister had had no name, sir.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Why, man?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Why, sir, her name's a word; and to dally with that

speaker: Clown
text_entry: word might make my sister wanton. But indeed words

speaker: Clown
text_entry: are very rascals since bonds disgraced them.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Thy reason, man?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Troth, sir, I can yield you none without words; and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: words are grown so false, I am loath to prove

speaker: Clown
text_entry: reason with them.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I warrant thou art a merry fellow and carest for nothing.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Not so, sir, I do care for something; but in my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: conscience, sir, I do not care for you: if that be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: to care for nothing, sir, I would it would make you invisible.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Art not thou the Lady Olivia's fool?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: No, indeed, sir; the Lady Olivia has no folly: she

speaker: Clown
text_entry: will keep no fool, sir, till she be married; and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: fools are as like husbands as pilchards are to

speaker: Clown
text_entry: herrings; the husband's the bigger: I am indeed not

speaker: Clown
text_entry: her fool, but her corrupter of words.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I saw thee late at the Count Orsino's.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Foolery, sir, does walk about the orb like the sun,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: it shines every where. I would be sorry, sir, but

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the fool should be as oft with your master as with

speaker: Clown
text_entry: my mistress: I think I saw your wisdom there.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Nay, an thou pass upon me, I'll no more with thee.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Hold, there's expenses for thee.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Now Jove, in his next commodity of hair, send thee a beard!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: By my troth, I'll tell thee, I am almost sick for

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: one;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Aside

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: though I would not have it grow on my chin. Is thy

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: lady within?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Would not a pair of these have bred, sir?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Yes, being kept together and put to use.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I would play Lord Pandarus of Phrygia, sir, to bring

speaker: Clown
text_entry: a Cressida to this Troilus.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I understand you, sir; 'tis well begged.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: The matter, I hope, is not great, sir, begging but

speaker: Clown
text_entry: a beggar: Cressida was a beggar. My lady is

speaker: Clown
text_entry: within, sir. I will construe to them whence you

speaker: Clown
text_entry: come; who you are and what you would are out of my

speaker: Clown
text_entry: welkin, I might say 'element,' but the word is over-worn.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: This fellow is wise enough to play the fool;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And to do that well craves a kind of wit:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: He must observe their mood on whom he jests,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: The quality of persons, and the time,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And, like the haggard, cheque at every feather

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: That comes before his eye. This is a practise

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: As full of labour as a wise man's art

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: For folly that he wisely shows is fit;

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: But wise men, folly-fall'n, quite taint their wit.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Enter SIR TOBY BELCH, and SIR ANDREW

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Save you, gentleman.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And you, sir.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: Dieu vous garde, monsieur.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Et vous aussi; votre serviteur.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: I hope, sir, you are; and I am yours.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Will you encounter the house? my niece is desirous

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: you should enter, if your trade be to her.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I am bound to your niece, sir; I mean, she is the

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: list of my voyage.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Taste your legs, sir; put them to motion.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My legs do better understand me, sir, than I

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: understand what you mean by bidding me taste my legs.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: I mean, to go, sir, to enter.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I will answer you with gait and entrance. But we

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: are prevented.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Enter OLIVIA and MARIA

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Most excellent accomplished lady, the heavens rain

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: odours on you!

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: That youth's a rare courtier: 'Rain odours;' well.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My matter hath no voice, to your own most pregnant

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: and vouchsafed ear.

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: 'Odours,' 'pregnant' and 'vouchsafed:' I'll get 'em

speaker: SIR ANDREW
text_entry: all three all ready.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Let the garden door be shut, and leave me to my hearing.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH, SIR ANDREW, and MARIA

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Give me your hand, sir.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: My duty, madam, and most humble service.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: What is your name?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Cesario is your servant's name, fair princess.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: My servant, sir! 'Twas never merry world

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Since lowly feigning was call'd compliment:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: You're servant to the Count Orsino, youth.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And he is yours, and his must needs be yours:

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Your servant's servant is your servant, madam.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: For him, I think not on him: for his thoughts,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Would they were blanks, rather than fill'd with me!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Madam, I come to whet your gentle thoughts

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: On his behalf.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, by your leave, I pray you,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I bade you never speak again of him:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: But, would you undertake another suit,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I had rather hear you to solicit that

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Than music from the spheres.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Dear lady,--

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Give me leave, beseech you. I did send,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: After the last enchantment you did here,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: A ring in chase of you: so did I abuse

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Myself, my servant and, I fear me, you:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Under your hard construction must I sit,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: To force that on you, in a shameful cunning,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Which you knew none of yours: what might you think?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Have you not set mine honour at the stake

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And baited it with all the unmuzzled thoughts

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That tyrannous heart can think? To one of your receiving

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enough is shown: a cypress, not a bosom,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Hideth my heart. So, let me hear you speak.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I pity you.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That's a degree to love.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: No, not a grize; for 'tis a vulgar proof,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: That very oft we pity enemies.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Why, then, methinks 'tis time to smile again.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, world, how apt the poor are to be proud!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: If one should be a prey, how much the better

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: To fall before the lion than the wolf!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Clock strikes

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: The clock upbraids me with the waste of time.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Be not afraid, good youth, I will not have you:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: And yet, when wit and youth is come to harvest,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Your were is alike to reap a proper man:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: There lies your way, due west.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Then westward-ho! Grace and good disposition

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Attend your ladyship!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: You'll nothing, madam, to my lord by me?

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Stay:

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I prithee, tell me what thou thinkest of me.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: That you do think you are not what you are.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: If I think so, I think the same of you.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Then think you right: I am not what I am.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I would you were as I would have you be!

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Would it be better, madam, than I am?

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I wish it might, for now I am your fool.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: O, what a deal of scorn looks beautiful

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: In the contempt and anger of his lip!

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: A murderous guilt shows not itself more soon

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Than love that would seem hid: love's night is noon.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Cesario, by the roses of the spring,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: By maidhood, honour, truth and every thing,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: I love thee so, that, maugre all thy pride,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Nor wit nor reason can my passion hide.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Do not extort thy reasons from this clause,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: For that I woo, thou therefore hast no cause,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: But rather reason thus with reason fetter,

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Love sought is good, but given unsought better.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: By innocence I swear, and by my youth

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: I have one heart, one bosom and one truth,

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And that no woman has; nor never none

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Shall mistress be of it, save I alone.

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: And so adieu, good madam: never more

speaker: VIOLA
text_entry: Will I my master's tears to you deplore.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Yet come again; for thou perhaps mayst move

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: That heart, which now abhors, to like his love.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Exeunt
